conclusion: List the data: Mass of child is 30 kg, Mass of sled is 10 kg, Total mass is 40 kg, Pulling force is 100 N, Angle of pull is 37°, sin 37° is 0.6, cos 37° is 0.8, g is 10 m/s², Motion is at constant speed so acceleration is 0.
Resolve the pulling force into components: Horizontal component Fₓ is 80 N, Vertical component Fᵧ is 60 N.

Draw vertical-force balance for the system sled + child: Upward forces are the normal reaction from the ground N and the upward component of the pull Fᵧ which is 60 N. Downward force is the weight W which is 400 N.
Vertical acceleration is zero, so ΣFᵧ = 0 implies N + Fᵧ − W = 0.
Solve for the normal force: N = W − Fᵧ, N = 400 N − 60 N, N = 340 N.

Interpret pressure: In many elementary physics problems pressure exerted by the sled on the ground means the magnitude of the normal force. If actual pressure were required, the contact area would have to be given.
Final answer: The magnitude of the force exerted by the sled on the ground is N = 340 newtons.
